Venezula_Cuisine.name: Arepa
Venezula_Cuisine.iconic_place: Las Arepas de Los Hermanos Moya (La Polvorosa)
Venezula_Cuisine.description: Arepa is a highly versatile cornbread made from ground corn dough or precooked corn flour. It is commonly consumed in Venezuela, Colombia, Panama, Puerto Rico, and the Dominican Republic. In Venezuela, arepa is eaten at any time of the day, throughout the whole country, and across all socio-economic groups.

Venezula_Cuisine.name: Pabellón Criollo
Venezula_Cuisine.description: Pabellón criollo is a traditional Venezuelan dish consisting of black beans, white rice, and slices of steak cooked with tomatoes. The word pabellon means flag, referring to the colors of individual components, which are arranged to resemble the national flag.

Venezula_Cuisine.name: Sopa de Mondongo
Venezula_Cuisine.description: Sopa de mondongo is a hearty tripe and vegetable soup that includes beef or pork tripe, which is cooked with potatoes, cassava, corn, and cabbage.

Venezula_Cuisine.name: Tequeños
Venezula_Cuisine.description: Tequeños are a traditional Venezuelan snack consisting of fried wonton wrappers or empanada dough filled with cheese, often served with various dips.

Venezula_Cuisine.name: Pan de Jamón
Venezula_Cuisine.description: Pan de jamón is a Venezuelan bread stuffed with raisins, ham, and olives, especially popular during Christmas time.

Venezula_Cuisine.name: Hallaca
Venezula_Cuisine.description: Hallaca is a Venezuelan tamale made with corn flour dough filled with a stew of meat, wrapped in plantain leaves, and boiled. It is a traditional Christmas dish.

Venezula_Cuisine.name: Casabe
Venezula_Cuisine.description: Casabe is a traditional Venezuelan flatbread made from cassava flour, creating a crispy texture without any leavening agent.

Venezula_Cuisine.name: Arepa Reina Pepiada
Venezula_Cuisine.description: Arepa Reina Pepiada is a popular Venezuelan arepa filled with a combination of avocado, shredded chicken, lime, coriander, mayonnaise, and optional peas.

Venezula_Cuisine.name: Perico Venezolano
Venezula_Cuisine.description: Perico Venezolano is a scrambled egg dish made with onions, tomatoes, butter, and a blend of spices. It is a popular breakfast dish in both Venezuela and Colombia.

Venezula_Cuisine.name: Golfeados
Venezula_Cuisine.description: Golfeados are a Venezuelan version of cinnamon rolls, made with milk, yeast, sugar, flour, eggs, and butter, and flavored with cinnamon and star anise.

Venezula_Cuisine.name: Asado Negro
Venezula_Cuisine.description: Asado negro is a Venezuelan beef dish, made by slow-braising eye of round roast in red wine sauce until it attains a dark color.

Venezula_Cuisine.name: Majarete
Venezula_Cuisine.description: Majarete is a creamy Venezuelan pudding made from corn and coconut milk, similar to a corn pudding.

Venezula_Cuisine.name: Guasacaca
Venezula_Cuisine.description: Guasacaca is a Venezuelan dip similar to guacamole, made with avocado, coriander, parsley, bell peppers, onions, garlic, salt, oil, and vinegar, usually served with grilled meats.

Venezula_Cuisine.name: Cachapa
Venezula_Cuisine.description: Cachapa is a sweet corn pancake traditionally served with mozzarella cheese, popular throughout Venezuela.

Venezula_Cuisine.name: Caraotas Negras
Venezula_Cuisine.description: Caraotas negras are black beans, often served as a side dish or included in the Venezuelan national dish, pabellón criollo.

Venezula_Cuisine.name: Arepa Andina
Venezula_Cuisine.description: Arepa Andina is a variety of arepa made with wheat flour, popular in the Andes region of Venezuela.

Venezula_Cuisine.name: Mandoca
Venezula_Cuisine.description: Mandoca is a deep-fried snack made from cornmeal, plantains, panela sugar, and queso fresco, originating from the Zulia region.

Venezula_Cuisine.name: Arepa Frita
Venezula_Cuisine.description: Arepa frita is a deep-fried version of arepa, typically filled with cabbage, cheese, and various condiments like ketchup and mayonnaise.

Venezula_Cuisine.name: Buñuelos de Yuca
Venezula_Cuisine.description: Buñuelos de yuca is a deep-fried dessert made from grated cassava, sugar, and eggs, often served as a holiday treat.

Venezula_Cuisine.name: Sopa de Cebollin
Venezula_Cuisine.description: Sopa de cebollin is a Venezuelan soup made with chives, flour, butter, white wine, beef stock, and cream.
